info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 13 at 4:02AM CST by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...Winter Weather Expected Across Most of the Panhandles Monday... A vigorous upper level storm system is expected to move just south of the Texas Panhandle on Monday. Precipitation may start off as rain or rain mixed with snow late tonight in the western Panhandles, but will quickly switch over to all snow by sunrise Monday. The snow will then spread across the rest of the Panhandles during the day on Monday. Total snowfall accumulation of 1 to 3 inches will be possible across the Oklahoma Panhandle and the northern Texas Panhandle with up to 1 inch across the southern Texas Panhandle. The snow will end from west to east during the late afternoon Monday. Gusty north winds may reduce the visibility in blowing snow. Roads may become slick and snow-packed. The snow may affect the morning and evening commute. Be weather aware and keep up to date with the latest forecasts.
